action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 5138

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"C17": 903, "B41": 757, "A71": 850, "C00": 746, "B35": 524, "A77": 204, "A03": 946, "A04": 473, "C54": 616, "C01": 855, "A87": 530, "B32": 419, "B86": 960, "B33": 763, "A10": 730}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"C17": 138, "B41": 583, "A71": 868, "C00": 822, "B35": 783, "A77": 65, "A03": 262, "A04": 121, "C54": 508, "C01": 780, "A87": 461, "B32": 484, "B86": 668, "B33": 389, "A10": 808}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.
action.label: context

action.content:
Okay, let's start by understanding the problem. I need to negotiate a set of items with another participant, maximizing my own importance while keeping the total effort under 5138. The key is that I don't know the other person's importance values, so I have to make assumptions or strategies based on my own data.

First, I should calculate the total effort of all items to see if it's possible to take everything. Let me sum up the effort values:

C17:903, B41:757, A71:850, C00:746, B35:524, A77:204, A03:946, A04:473, C54:616, C01:855, A87:530, B32:419, B86:960, B33:763, A10:730.

Adding these up: 903+757=1660, +850=2510, +746=3256, +524=3780, +204=3984, +946=4930, +473=5403. Wait, that's already over 5138. So taking all items isn't possible. So I need to select a subset.

My goal is to maximize my importance. So I should prioritize items with high importance relative to their effort. Maybe calculate importance per effort ratio. Let's compute that for each item.

For example, C17: 138/903 ≈ 0.153. B41:583/757≈0.770. A71:868/850≈1.021. C00:822/746≈1.102. B35:783/524≈1.494. A77:65/204≈0.319. A03:262/946≈0.277. A04:121/473≈0.256. C54:508/616≈0.824. C01:780/855≈0.912. A87:461/530≈0.870. B32:484/419≈1.155. B86:668/960≈0.696. B33:389/763≈0.510. A10:808/730≈1.107.

So the highest ratios are B35 (1.494), C00 (1.102), A10 (1.107), B32 (1.155), A71 (1.021), C01 (0.912), A87 (0.870), C54 (0.824), B41 (0.770), B86 (0.696), C17 (0.153), A03 (0.277), A04 (0.256), A77 (0.319), B33 (0.510).

So the top items by ratio are B35, B32, C00, A10, A71, C01, etc. So maybe start by selecting these high ratio items first.

But I need to make sure the total effort doesn't exceed 5138. Let's try to build a set step by step.

Next is B41 (757) → 4654+757=5411, which is over. B86 (960) is way over. A03 (946) is also over. So maybe the set up to A87 is 4654. Then maybe add some lower effort items. So the set would be B35, B32, C00, A10, A71, C01, A87, A04. Let's check the total effort: 524+419+746+730+850+855+530+473. Let me add them step by step:

524 + 419 = 943

4654+473=5127. Yes, under 5138. The total importance would be 783+484+822+808+868+780+461+121. Let's calculate that:

1267+822=2089

2089+808=2897

2897+868=3765

3765+780=4545

4545+461=5006

5006+121=5127. So total importance 5127. That's a good start. But maybe there's a better combination. For example, maybe replacing some items. But since I don't know the other's importance, I have to go with my own.

But the problem is that the other person might have different priorities. However, since I can't know, I need to make a proposal that's optimal for me. So the initial proposal could be this set. But I need to make sure that the total effort is under 5138. The set I have is 5127, which is under. So that's a valid proposal.

But maybe there's a way to include more items. Let's see. After A04, maybe add A77 (204) but that would make 5127+204=5331, which is over. What about A03 (946)? 5127+946=6073, way over. C17 (903) is also over. So no. So the maximum I can get is 5127. Alternatively, maybe replace some items. For example, if I remove A04 (473) and add A77 (204) and maybe another item. But 5127 -473 = 4654. Then adding A77 (204) gives 4654+204=4858. Then maybe add another item. Let's see, B86 (960) is too much. C17 (903) is 4858+903=5761, over. B33 (763) is 4858+763=5621, over. A03 (946) is 4858+946=5804, over. So no. So that's worse. So the initial set is better.

Alternatively, maybe remove some lower importance items. For example, if I remove A04 (121) and add something else. But 5127-121=5006. Then maybe add B33 (763) → 5006+763=5769, over. Not helpful. So the initial set seems optimal.

So my first proposal would be the set {B35, B32, C00, A10, A71, C01, A87, A04}. Let me check the effort again to confirm. Yes, 5127. That's under 5138. So that's a valid proposal. Then, in the ARGUMENT, I can explain that I selected items with the highest importance per effort ratio to maximize my total importance. The STRATEGIC REASONING would outline this approach.
